snippet.title: The Rolling Stones and Philosophy: It's Just a Thought Away

snippet.title: Rock Eras: Interpretations of Music and Society, 1954-1984 - Page 207
snippet.description: Where the Everlies put guitars and voices in sync to put across teenage mawkishness, as in "Wake Up Little Susie," the Stones put guitar and voice out of sync to dramatize despair and exploitation. "Satisfaction" is the first anthem of the sixties.
